forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Mostly cloudy. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 14 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 33 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. Low around 52, with temperatures rising to around 54 overnight. South southeast wind 17 to 31 mph, with gusts as high as 55 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between three quarters and one inch possible.

weather_report:
As the day unfolds in Downtown San Francisco, a shroud of clouds envelops the city, casting a muted light across its iconic skyline. The rain is not just a possibility; it has begun to weave itself into the fabric of the day, creating a backdrop that feels both introspective and slightly melancholic. The high temperature wrestles with the chill of the season, settling around 58 degrees and gradually yielding to cooler afternoons. Winds from the southeast whip through the streets, bringing with them both a brisk freshness and the promise of more rain, which, later tonight, will intensify, turning into a steady downpour with substantial accumulation expected. 

Visibility may be compromised as the fog mingles with a low marine layer, softly blurring the edges of the Golden Gate, reminding us of the city's propensity to dance with the elements. Dressing appropriately becomes essential; a warm, waterproof layer, perhaps accompanied by a cozy scarf, would serve you well. Today is a perfect day for quieter pleasures—an invitation to linger in a café with a good book or to explore local galleries, sampling the art that reflects the soul of this vibrant metropolis. As night approaches, the rhythmic sound of rain will set the perfect scene for comfort, urging you to embrace the cozy indoors rather than wander the dampened streets.
